column1: Gwen went back to school feeling rather tamed and sober. The bad cold and face-ache
column2: subsequent on her adventure in the snow
column3: had seriously interfered with her plans for the holidays
column4: and she had not accomplished half she intended to do in the time. Dick Chambers had been laid up in bed with an attack of rheumatism
column5: so she had scarcely seen anything of him
column6: and altogether the much-longed-for month had held its disappointments. She returned to her desk in the Fifth almost glad to begin a fresh term
column7: though she knew many difficulties awaited her. First and foremost was the horrible fact that she owed a whole sovereign to Netta Goodwin
column8: and had absolutely no prospect of paying it. She tried to avoid any private conversation with her chum
column9: but the ruse was not successful for long. Netta was a girl who was accustomed to get her own way
column10: and she followed Gwen round the school until she caught her alone.
